title: The cast of The View bids goodbye to longtime ABC staffer who died of ovarian cancer
text:
The women of The View took a moment out of the show on Thursday to pay tribute to a longtime ABC staffer who died of ovarian cancer at the age of 39 on Monday.

Lauren Brennan Anglero was diagnosed with the disease just months ago, but passed away on October 21, leaving behind a husband and two-and-a-half-year-old twins.

Lauren enjoyed a 16-year-long career at ABC that began on The View and included time at other shows and a gig as Barbara Walters‘ assistant.

Tragic: Longtime ABC staffer Lauren Brennan Anglero passed away on October 21, leaving behind a husband and two-and-a-half-year-old twins

Missed: The 39-year-old had been diagnosed with ovarian cancer just months ago

'We have a tough goodbye to say,' Whoopi Goldberg said on The View.

'We want to mention the passing of a former staff member, Lauren Brennan Anglero, who worked here for many years. This is a very sad story,' Joy Behar added.

'She lost her battle with ovarian cancer this week. She worked at ABC for 16 years, and her first job was at The View. She was only 39 years old.'

'And she leaves behind her husband, Jerry, and two lovely twins. Our hearts go out to her family. It’s a very, very, sad story. A 39-year-old girl. And it was a short illness, and she just passed away.'

According to People, Lauren and Jerry Anglero's twins, Aubrey and Mason, were born four months premature and have special needs.

On TV: The women of The View took a moment out of the show on Thursday to pay tribute to her

Health check: Whoopi Goldberg encouraged people to get themselves checked

'Make sure that you get yourself checked,' Whoopi added. 'If you’re walking around today, make sure you check yourself. Make sure you’re doing fine.'

Her husband Jerry, whom she'd been with for 19 years, also shared a message on Facebook.

'Don’t know where to begin don’t know how I’m even writing this my heart is in a million pieces right now. My wife, my rock, my sunshine, the love of my life, my sidekick, the mother of my children, but most of all my true best friend Lauren Brennan Anglero has passed on to a better place.

'She lost her fight to cancer. God has gained another angel and do we know she was an angel here. Laur I can’t even imagine life without you but always know this I will not let you down with our babies. Bay I love you may you rest in peace.'

Helping out: A GoFundMe page raising money for her family has raised over $11,000

Heartbroken: Her husband Jerry described her as 'm wife, my rock, my sunshine, the love of my life, my sidekick, the mother of my children, but most of all my true best friend'

A GoFundMe page raising money for her family has raised over $11,000 and also pays tribute to Lauren.

'Lauren was the one person anyone could go to for a smile, a comforting word or for just that moment of joy when needed. She gave and supported any and everyone in her family, community and co-workers at ABC,' it reads.

'So as we prepare to say to our "see you laters" while laying her to rest we are asking that anyone who can help support in anyway to please do so.

'With everyone’s help we are hoping to ease the financial burden as her husband now has a long road ahead of him in raising his two babies on his own.'
description: Lauren Brennan Anglero passed away on October 21, months after being diagnosed. She left behind a husband and two-and-a-half-year-old twins.
